properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 17 at 12:30PM EST until January 18 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Cleveland OH
properties.description:
...Storm System Will Bring Wintry Weather to the Region...

.A low pressure system will move northeast through the central
Great Lakes Saturday. The combination of the cold air in place
and plenty of moisture with the storm system will result in snow
initially. The snow will become mixed with or change over to
freezing rain by Saturday morning for a period of time before
becoming all rain. The low pressure system will move northeast of
the area taking the precipitation with it Saturday night.

* WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of
3 to 5 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Downslope
winds gusting as high as 45 mph, mainly in northern Erie County.

* WHERE...Northern Erie, Southern Erie and Crawford counties.

* WHEN...From 2 AM to 10 PM EST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will begin to move into the area late
tonight. The heaviest snow will fall tonight before becoming
mixed with and changing over to freezing rain and sleet early
Saturday afternoon. The freezing rain and sleet should only last
one to three hours before the it transitions to all rain. Snow
showers will return Saturday night as cold air moves into the
area.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania
Turnpike Commission remind motorists to adjust speeds based on
driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania
roadways. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway, and
traffic conditions.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 10 PM EST SATURDAY
